comment: Smart data models - Tank schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.S4BLDG/master/Tank/schema.json
description: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.

contents.name: accessType
contents.comment: Property. Defines the types of access (or cover) to a tank that may be specified. Note that covers are generally specified for rectangular tanks. For cylindrical tanks, access will normally be via a manhole.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: effectiveCapacity
contents.comment: Property. The total effective or actual volumetric capacity of the tank. Usually measured in cubic metre (m3).B3

contents.name: endShapeType
contents.comment: Property. Defines the types of end shapes that can be used for preformed tanks. The convention for reading these enumerated values is that for a vertical cylinder, the first value is the base and the second is the top for a horizontal cylinder, the order of reading should be left to right. For a speherical tank, the value UNSET should be used.B5

contents.name: firstCurvatureRadius
contents.comment: Property. FirstCurvatureRadius should be defined as the base or left side radius of curvature value. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: hasManufacturer
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: hasModel
contents.comment: Property. A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: nominalDepth
contents.comment: Property. The nominal depth of the tank. Note: Not required for a horizontal cylindrical tank. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: nominalLengthOrDiameter
contents.comment: Property. The nominal length or, in the case of a vertical cylindrical tank, the nominal diameter of the tank. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: nominalVolumetricCapacity
contents.comment: Property. The total nominal or design volumetric capacity of the tank. Usually measured in cubic metre (m3).

contents.name: nominalWidthOrDiameter
contents.comment: Property. The nominal width or, in the case of a horizontal cylindrical tank, the nominal diameter of the tank. Note: Not required for a vertical cylindrical tank. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: numberOfSections
contents.comment: Property. Number of sections used.

contents.name: operatingWeight
contents.comment: Property. Operating weight of the tank including all of its contents. Usually measured in kilograms (kg) or grams (g).

contents.name: patternType
contents.comment: Property. Defines the types of pattern (or shape of a tank that may be specified.

contents.name: secondCurvatureRadius
contents.comment: Property. SecondCurvatureRadius should be defined as the top or right side radius of curvature value. Usually measured in millimeters (mm).

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: storageType
contents.comment: Property. Defines the general material category intended to be stored.

contents.name: isSubSystemOf
contents.comment: Relationship. A reference to a system(s) that this Physical Object is part of.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
